summary.Title: Backend Developer - Payment Infrastructure
summary.Presentation:
Help shape the future of Nordic e-commerce by building robust payment solutions in a fast-moving, autonomous team.
About the job

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Help shape the future of Nordic e-commerce by building robust payment solutions in a fast-moving, autonomous team.

About the job

You will be joining the OnPay team, developing a leading payment solution that serves e-commerce customers across the Nordics. Online payments are becoming more prevalent every day and our mission is to support our growing merchants by remaining at the forefront of product offerings and reliability. This is where you come in.

We're seeking someone to accelerate our backend development, focusing on strategic initiatives like expanding our network of acquiring banks and streamlining API integrations across team.blue brands. You'll have significant responsibility for delivering high-quality software, deploying frequently, and working within our Scrum framework.

As a team, we collaborate on the entire software development lifecycle where security and compliance are fundamental to OnPay’s success and require high attention to detail to ensure that the millions of transactions we process monthly remain secure and seamless.

 

Your profile

We are looking for someone that is passionate about online payments and the surrounding software ecosystem. There are many different backgrounds that could be successful in this role, so we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements below.

Requirements: 

  • Well versed in object-oriented code, and willingness to work with PHP and Symfony
  • Great communication skills (our team language is English)
  • Structured, proactive, and with an eye for detail
  • Knowledgeable about security as it relates to software
  • Passionate about technology and staying up to date
  • Linux and command line experience
  • Version control workflows (we use Git & GitLab)
  • Experience consuming and developing API’s
  • Resident of the EU or UK
  • Ability to travel to Denmark a few times a year

Nice to have

  • Payment industry experience (e-commerce experience is also helpful)
  • Experience working within the PCI-DSS or another audited environment
  • Knowledge of Scrum

 

What we offer

You will be joining a high-impact team where your ideas matter. At OnPay, we combine the agility of a small team with the resources and opportunities of being a part of team.blue. Our flat structure means ideas go from concept to production, with minimal bureaucracy in the way.

We believe great work happens when talented people are given the space to focus. That's why we minimize meetings and protect deep work time, allowing you to craft exceptional solutions for our customers.

Working with us, you will get:

  • A safe and flexible working environment
  • Professional sparring with some of the best in the industry
  • Professional development courses and relevant certifications
  • A healthy work-life balance
  • Possibility to work either remote or from our offices in Europe

 

How to apply

Any questions about the position can be sent to Software Team Lead, Keenan Linsly, at keenan.linsly@team.blue

If you want to apply for the position, use the button “Apply for this job” 

We evaluate and interview candidates on a rolling basis, so please apply as soon as possible if the job sounds just like you.

Place of work: Fully remote, or one of our offices either partially remote or full-time office

Start: As soon as possible

Occupation.Name: Programmør og systemudvikler
AlternateNames: Programmør til numeriske værktøjer og processer
